Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: There’s a lot here.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Is Michelle a psychopath looking for sympathy?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: A delusional narcissist?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: An unwell teenage girl so devoid of self-worth that she psychotically over-identifies with a fictional character?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Someone deeply moved by television?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: You could find evidence for any of those readings.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The moment is The Girl from Plainville at its best: an exploration of the human behind a seemingly monstrous act (Carter was convicted of involuntary manslaughter in a precedent-setting case in 2017 for telling Roy, in several text messages for weeks before his death, to kill himself).

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: It’s also indicative of the fundamental awkwardness of this show, an overlong deluge of unease which gestures at a lot of thorny, circular issues but barely digs into the mess of the real story.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Some of this discomfort – the mysterious, bizarre darkness of abnormal psychology, the power of digital communications to warp one’s sense of reality, too-strong identifications with celebrities – feels earned, suggestive, rich.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: But a lot of it stems from the show’s premise, in making what is fundamentally entertainment out of the deeply tragic digital union of two very wounded, very fragile teenagers.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The Girl from Plainville, as a recent true crime series, continually raises the question for its justification – what does this add to a story we already know?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Can entertainment illuminate without exploiting?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: – and doesn’t seem to know the answer.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The Girl from Plainville, created by Liz Hannah and Patrick Macmanus, exists at the intersection of several popular TV subgenres.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: It’s another example of a 2010s headline turned popular documentary/podcast/exposé turned limited series – a narrative second draft of history, as in The Dropout, WeCrashed, Super Pumped and Inventing Anna.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: (The Girl from Plainville is based on an Esquire article on the real trial, which is also the subject of the 2019 two-part HBO documentary I Love You, Now Die, directed by Erin Lee Carr.) It’s interested in the psychology of chronic lies, such as in the aforementioned true-scam shows, HBO’s Winning Time (on a business level) and Hulu’s The Act (about an infamous 2010s Munchausen-by-proxy story, also explored in Carr’s first documentary, Mommy Dead and Dearest).

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: It offers a complicating, if not redemptive, character study of a publicly villainized woman, a la Pam & Tommy, Impeachment: American Crime Story or documentaries on Britney Spears, Janet Jackson and Lorena Bobbitt.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: There’s the interest in teen mental health and suicide, as in the controversial Netflix hit 13 Reasons Why and the moral panic over HBO’s hit Euphoria.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: In The Girl from Plainville and most of the aforementioned shows, there’s also the evergreen and uncanny frisson of seeing a well-known actor transform through hair, makeup, costume and prosthetics into a well-known figure.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: In other words, much of what The Girl from Plainville is doing is familiar, on a thematic and narrative level; it employs some well-worn prestige TV tropes for better (an interest in the brittle grief of Coco’s mom Lynn, played wonderfully by Chloe Sevigny; meticulous costuming and set design that captures the vibe of suburban 2012-2014) and for worse (muddled multiple timelines, a lagging eight-hour runtime that could have been four).

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The show is most novel and intriguing in its attempt to convey the emotional realism of consistent texting.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: In the first three episodes – the immediate aftermath of Coco’s suicide on one timeline, and the initiation of their relationship on a Florida vacation on the other – the phone screen is a haunting presence.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Michelle hovers over hers with near-religious fervor, typing and retyping and staring at messages; Lynn’s grief is patterned by texts and calls; Coco buries his chronic depression and loneliness into his phone.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: By the fourth episode, which dropped last week (the remaining four will air weekly), Coco and Michelle are deep in their secret correspondence – nebulous, toxic, psychoactive.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The couple, who only met in person a handful of times, were less lovers than voices in each other’s heads.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The show captures some of that blurriness, and why adults just didn’t get it, by putting the texts in the actors’ mouths.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Their digital conversations (pulled, it seems, from the real texts) play out as fantasy sequences, one imagining the other in the room with them, staring ravenously at them, as they type.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: But we barely get to feel it, as the spliced timeline undercuts their exchanges.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: A fourth episode scene in which Coco tells Michelle that he attempted suicide, for example, cuts to a standard procedural scene in which the prosecutor mulls over zero-sum strategy for how to best pursue Michelle at trial.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: It’s a frustrating watch; the show’s quality, particularly Fanning and Ryan’s instinctive performances, masks the shallowness of too many ideas, not enough clarity.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The first half of the season mostly keeps Michelle a cipher, perhaps necessary for a person who has never participated in a formal interview since her 2015 indictment and did not speak at trial, but an ultimately uncomfortable decision.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: The intentional, interesting discomfort – reconciling what Michelle said with the vulnerable character on-screen – quickly elides with discomfort over the whole project.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Michelle Carter was 17 years old when this all happened.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: There’s a version of this story that is even more sympathetic to her, a girl who long struggled with eating disorders and anxiety (suggested but not overt in early episodes) who also experienced suicidal ideation as a teen.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: How much creative license is fair with these real stories?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Which truth gets the most bearing?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Does audience or truth matter more?

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: These are all messy questions without easy answers, and I say that as someone who will watch the whole series.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: It’s fitting, I suppose, for an incredibly messy story; the deeper you go – and with all the coverage of the trial, its thousands of pages of text message records, you can go very deep – the messier it gets.

Title: The Girl from Plainville: the unease of TV’s latest true crime hit
Line: Yet you can somehow watch The Girl from Plainville and forget how tragic this whole story is, which is maybe the most uneasy thing of all.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical
Line: John Cameron Mitchell’s grunge musical is the strangest of shows.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical
Line: It combines the kind of high-camp monologue you’d expect at a cabaret club – all knowing narcissism and arch innuendo – with a set of authentically scuzzy rock songs that recall the sounds of a 90s basement dive.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical
Line: Neither has much to do with the other.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical
Line: Dating from 1998, the show prefigures the gig-theatre wave of the last decade and yet exists in its own self-referential universe, too sketchy for narrative engagement, too meandering for emotional impact.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical
Line: In 2022, some aspects seem stranger still.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical
Line: Maybe we can accept Hedwig’s origins in communist East Berlin, but the jokes about Manhattan districts and US middle-of-the-road bands are from another place and time.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical
Line: And yet this high-class production by Jamie Fletcher shows it is in keeping with our gender-fluid age.

Title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch review – Divina De Campo brings drag queen swagger to grunge musical

Title: Customs IT meltdown adds to long delays at Channel crossings

Title: ‘Judge Jackson stands on the shoulders of giants’: women of color on a day to celebrate
Line: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s nomination to the US supreme court has passed the Senate and she will now become the first Black female justice on America’s highest legal body after being nominated by Joe Biden earlier this year.

Title: ‘Judge Jackson stands on the shoulders of giants’: women of color on a day to celebrate
Line: Jackson’s nomination has been widely praised by women of color, especially after she sustained grueling confirmation hearings at the hands of some top Republicans who seemed dedicated to political points-scoring and whose criticisms often seemed like racist dog-whistling.

Title: ‘Judge Jackson stands on the shoulders of giants’: women of color on a day to celebrate
Line: Jackson “proves her commitment not only to public service but to equal justice and equal rights”, Harris added.

Title: ‘Judge Jackson stands on the shoulders of giants’: women of color on a day to celebrate
Line: “As she makes history, Judge Jackson, like us all, stands on the shoulders of giants.

Title: ‘Judge Jackson stands on the shoulders of giants’: women of color on a day to celebrate
Line: She and we are their legacy.” Fatima Goss Graves, president and CEO of the National Women’s Law Center “The world demands untold levels of strength from Black women on a daily basis.

Title: ‘Judge Jackson stands on the shoulders of giants’: women of color on a day to celebrate

Title: ‘Judge Jackson stands on the shoulders of giants’: women of color on a day to celebrate
Line: Judges and lawyers who have known her in every capacity uniformly praised her character, calling her integrity ‘beyond reproach’, ‘first rate’, and ‘impeccable’.” “Our extensive review leads us to conclude that Judge Jackson meets the highest standards of integrity, professional competence, and judicial temperament,” Williams continued, granting Jackson the ABA’s highest rating.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson reached a historic milestone on Thursday, becoming the first Black woman ever appointed to the US supreme court.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: But before Jackson could be confirmed, she first had to navigate a brutal opposition campaign from far-right critics who challenged her credentials and outlandishly accused her of supporting child abuse.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: The bareknuckle tactics used by some Republicans to discredit Jackson underscored just how far to the right the party has drifted and may foreshadow a new, disturbing “normal” for American politics.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: The Republican senator Roger Wicker offered a preview of the ugly attacks to come when he said in late January, before Jackson was even nominated, that Joe Biden’s appointee would be the beneficiary of affirmative action because the president had already promised to select a Black woman for the post.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: That comment sparked outrage among Democrats, who noted Biden would have a wealth of qualified candidates to choose from to fill Stephen Breyer’s seat.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: After Jackson’s nomination was announced in February, Tucker Carlson, the far-right Fox News host, took it a step further by demanding that the White House release her score on the LSAT, a standardized test for law school applicants.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “So is Ketanji Brown Jackson – a name that even Joe Biden has trouble pronouncing – one of the top legal minds in the entire country?” Carlson asked.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “[I]t might be time for Joe Biden to let us know what Ketanji Brown Jackson’s LSAT score was … It would seem like Americans in a democracy have a right to know.” Carlson’s complaint seemed to ignore that Jackson is considered one of the most qualified supreme court nominees in recent history.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: She has served as a supreme court clerk, a public defender, a district court judge, a member of the US Sentencing Commission and a federal appeals judge.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: Carlson’s mockery of Jackson’s first name, which is pronounced “kee-TON-jee,” also struck critics as a racist dog-whistle.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: But worse was to come.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: The beginning of Jackson’s confirmation hearings last month spurred a new, alarming line of attack from certain Republicans.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: In a Twitter thread shared days before the start of the hearings, Josh Hawley, a member of the Senate judiciary committee, claimed Jackson had a “pattern of letting child porn offenders off the hook for their appalling crimes”.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: Hawley’s claims were quickly debunked by factcheckers and even conservative legal experts, who showed that Jackson’s sentencing practices for child abuse image offenders were in the mainstream for federal judges.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: One White House official dismissed Hawley’s claims as an “embarrassing, QAnon-signaling smear”, referring to the baseless conspiracy theory that Democratic leaders are members of an evil cabal involved in child sex trafficking.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: The left-leaning organization Media Matters reported that Hawley’s comments quickly spread on internet forums linked to QAnon.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: But instead of abandoning the accusation when it was proved to be demonstrably false and potentially dangerous, more Republican senators joined Hawley in grilling Jackson about her handling of child abuse cases.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: Lindsey Graham, who voted to confirm Jackson to the US court of appeals for the DC circuit last year, told her during the hearings, “Every judge who does what you are doing is making it easier for the children to be exploited.” Graham, who previously voted for both of Barack Obama’s supreme court nominees and has now become a close ally of Donald Trump, serves as a case study in the Republican party’s move toward the far right.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “Lindsey Graham is the epitome of a political parasite.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: He needs to have a host in order to thrive,” said Tara Setmayer, a former House Republican communications adviser who left the party in 2020.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “He did it with John McCain.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: He did it again with Donald Trump.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: And now he’s doing it with the Maga/QAnon base in order to maintain relevancy.” Jim Manley, a former senior adviser to the late Democratic Senate majority leader Harry Reid, said it was “shocking yet not surprising” to see Senate Republicans resorting to such tactics.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “It was one thing to work in the Senate and to watch traditionally conservative senators like Chuck Grassley start spouting Tea Party lines in 2009, 2010,” Manley said.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “But to see more and more House and Senate Republicans spout QAnon-friendly talking points is a whole ’nother ballgame and shows to me that there’s a real poison moving through the Republican party.” It should be noted that three Senate Republicans – Susan Collins, Lisa Murkowski and Mitt Romney – supported Jackson’s nomination.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: When Murkowski and Romney announced their support earlier this week, the extremist congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene responded by explicitly accusing Jackson and her supporters of endorsing child sexual abuse.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “Any Senator voting to confirm #KJB is pro-pedophile just like she is,” Greene said on Twitter.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “You are either a Senator that supports child rapists, child pornography, and the most vile child predators.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: Or you are a Senator who protects children and votes NO to KJB!” Setmayer warned that Republican leaders’ refusal to condemn the rhetoric of Greene and her ilk will only encourage lawmakers to offer more appeals to QAnon supporters.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “They are in the driver’s seat of today’s Republican party, as much as the establishment wants to deny that,” Setmayer said.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “And not only is it dangerous, but it undermines our democracy, when people like this are given a platform and are given power.” Manley echoed that point, warning that some Republicans’ embrace of conspiracy theories will make it all the more difficult for Congress to pass even the most basic legislation, such as government funding bills.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “I’ve been saying for years the Senate is broken.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: But what I saw during these confirmation hearings has got me really concerned about our fundamental ability to legislate,” Manley said.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: “This is far beyond anything that I’ve ever seen before in my time on Capitol Hill.” And there are no signs of this increased extremism among Republican members of Congress diminishing anytime soon.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right
Line: According to Media Matters, at least 59 congressional candidates in the 2022 election cycle have expressed some level of support for QAnon.

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right

Title: Republicans’ ugly attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson show lurch to far right

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s confirmation to the US supreme court shatters several glass ceilings in America’s long struggle to form a more perfect union.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Not only will she be the first Black woman to sit on the court since it assembled in 1790.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: She will also be the first justice with experience as a public defender to join a bench that has hosted many former prosecutors.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: When Jackson takes her seat on the nine-justice panel, following Stephen Breyer’s retirement probably in June, she will also raise its female contingent to four – a historic number that brings a majority of female justices within reach.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: On a more personal level, her promotion to the supreme court is the fulfillment of her ambition to excel at the law which she has nurtured from a young age.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: It is the realization of the promise given to her by her parents, who were themselves brought up under the ignominies of racial segregation in the US south.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: As Jackson said in her opening remarks to the confirmation process: “My parents taught me that, unlike the many barriers that they had had to face growing up, my path was clearer, such that if I worked hard and believed in myself, in America I could do anything or be anything I wanted to be.” Jackson, 51, was born in Washington DC where her parents, Johnny and Ellery Brown, relocated to escape Jim Crow in the great migration.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: The family moved back to Miami, Florida, where she spent most of her childhood.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: She caught the legal bug from her father who trained to be a lawyer as a mature student when she was at preschool.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: “He had his stack of law books on the kitchen table while I sat across from him with my stack of coloring books,” she told the Senate judiciary committee.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Jackson imbibed from her parents a pride in her roots.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: They gave her an African name: “Ketanji Onyika”, meaning “lovely one”.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Born in 1970, Jackson describes herself as a child of the 70s.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: She was aware that the educational and other opportunities she enjoyed as a member of a burgeoning Black professional class were a product of the civil rights struggles of the 1950s and 60s.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: After Miami Palmetto senior high school she studied as an undergraduate at Harvard, followed by Harvard law school.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: It was at college that she met her husband, a surgeon, Patrick Jackson; they have two daughters, Talia, 21, and Leila, 17.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: At her confirmation hearings, Republican senators attempted to depict Jackson as a rabid leftist in hock to socialist groups.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: The truth is much less dramatic: as an individual and a jurist, she has preferred compromise over conflict, evidential fact over ideology.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: “She was always the person trying to find the middle ground,” one of her Harvard roommates, Nina Coleman Simmons, told the Washington Post.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Pressed by Republicans at the confirmation hearings to divulge her “judicial philosophy”, she insisted she had none.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Rather, she relied on what she called a “methodology” based on neutrality, the facts in the case and a faithful reading of the law.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Jackson emphasized at the confirmation hearings that her outlook was influenced by her wider family.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: She has two uncles who were police officers in Miami while her brother, Ketajh, worked for the Baltimore police department before joining the Maryland army national guard.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Jackson did not mention that she had another uncle, Thomas Brown, who was sentenced to life in prison for minor non-violent drug offenses under a brutal three-strikes law.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: He was released in 2017 after Obama commuted his sentence, but died soon after.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: We do not know, given her near silence on the issue, whether Thomas’s plight influenced her decision to work as a federal public defender in Washington.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: It is notable that during the two years she spent in that role she successfully challenged several cases involving excessively long sentences.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Republicans sought to cast doubt on her sentencing of sex offenders, implying she was sympathetically lenient towards them, but factcheckers have found her approach to have been entirely unremarkable for such cases.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: In probably her most famous district court ruling, in 2019 she ordered the former White House counsel Donald McGahn to testify before Robert Mueller’s inquiry into Russian interference.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Rejecting Donald Trump’s claim of executive privilege, she stated: “The primary takeaway from the past 250 years of recorded American history is that presidents are not kings.” Trump was also the subject of one of the few cases she has adjudicated on the federal appellate court in Washington since Joe Biden nominated her last year.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: In December she ruled for a second time against Trump, finding that the congressional committee investigating the Capitol insurrection on January 6 had a right to see White House records.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Jackson’s arrival on the highest court will not change its six conservative to three liberal-leaning power balance.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: But given that supreme court justices are appointed for life, she could serve for three decades or more and in so doing help to shape the country’s judicial landscape for at least a generation.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: There will be no honeymoon period: she will be flung immediately into some extremely thorny cases in her debut October 2022 term.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: She has said that she will recuse herself from one of the most politically charged cases on the docket – challenges to affirmative action at Harvard and the University of North Carolina – given her current role with Harvard’s board of overseers.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: But there are many more highly contentious cases already piling up, including a dispute over the Clean Water Act relating to wetlands, a look at welfare laws for Native American children, and the question of whether artists, in this case a website designer, can be obliged to do work celebrating gay marriage when it goes against their religious beliefs.

Title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s blazing trail to become the first Black female justice
Line: Her initiation to the nation’s highest court is already shaping up to be a blockbuster.

Line: And the scenes at Penny’s workplace are excruciating in their replication of digital marketing jargon, especially when written in email form.

Line: But this sometimes reads like shallow buzzword regurgitation, such as when Penny thinks: “I have such respect for an ethically sound company led almost exclusively by women, several of them women of colour.” Like so many women in so many of these books, Penny is a hot mess.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: She is a master of self-sabotage.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: Her inner monologue is often unkind, to herself and to others; there are various instances of fatphobia throughout the novel, and perhaps they are there to illustrate the vapid concerns of twentysomethings, but it is still uncomfortable to read.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: Penny’s sessions with her psychologist Dr Minnick call to mind the patient-doctor relationship in the excellent television show Crazy Ex-Girlfriend.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: Dr Minnick’s dialogue sometimes reads like a self-help book, but Novak’s intent is admirable.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: There are many similarities to British author Dolly Alderton’s 2020 novel Ghosts, not least the fact that the elusive objects of both protagonists’ affections share a first name.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: Like Penny, Alderton’s narrator Nina finds herself casting unfair judgment on her friends in light of her own romantic failures.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: The contrast is that Nina’s journey ends not with romance, but acceptance that her life may not mirror the conventional path.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: Nina, though, is in her early thirties – what a difference a few years may make.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: While Penny concedes by the end of No Hard Feelings that rewards can be found in new beginnings, or simply living in the moment, and not only in fairytale endings, her happiness still comes from external sources: a steady boyfriend, a higher-paying job.

Title: No Hard Feelings by Genevieve Novak review – another hot-mess-millennial novel
Line: Perhaps this is simply the reality of living under capitalism in the west – even when emotional peace is the goal, these traditional arbiters of success continue to signify a satisfying ending.

Line: However, campaigns that conflate the cruelty of elephant rides and dolphin attractions with the conservation dividends supported by sustainable hunting (Letters, 1 April) risk decreasing animal welfare and imperilling biodiversity.

Title: Regulated trophy hunting aids wildlife conservation
Line: In particular, calls to ban trophy imports, a major component of the bill and a sadly misguided manifesto promise, risk removing key incentives to conserve wildlife in many regions of global conservation significance.

Title: Regulated trophy hunting aids wildlife conservation
Line: Evidence shows that removing regulated trophy hunting – and the incentives it creates for conservation – without having viable funded alternatives ready can lead to greater losses of wildlife, due to subsequent increases in illegal, unsustainable and inhumane killings of animals using snares, dogs, local weapons and poisons.

Title: Regulated trophy hunting aids wildlife conservation
Line: A single trophy-hunted lion generates worldwide media attention, but the daily snaring and poisoning of lions in areas where they have little local value is largely ignored.

Title: Regulated trophy hunting aids wildlife conservation
Line: Simplistic solutions to complex problems rarely work.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: Police officers failed a vulnerable and suicidal woman after arresting her and putting her in a police cell where she killed herself, an inquest jury has found.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: Kelly Hartigan-Burns, 35, died in December 2016 after she was treated with “reckless indifference”, campaigners say, by police in Blackburn.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: She had been arrested after members of the public spotted her late at night walking in and out of traffic in her pyjamas saying she wanted to die.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: Her family fought for an inquest to be held, believing she was failed by Lancashire constabulary at every level, from the control room to the response on the street, in her home and at the police station.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: A jury at Preston coroner’s court agreed, concluding that “if officers had shown more compassion, acted diligently, practised common sense, followed guidance and procedure from the moment they found Kelly and throughout her detention, there may have been a different outcome”.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: The jury gave an open conclusion, with a narrative detailing a litany of failures that they said contributed to her death.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: In October 2021 a finding of gross misconduct was made against Jason Marsden, the custody sergeant involved in Hartigan-Burns’s case, barring him from returning to work for the police.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: After the arrest late on 3 December 2016, police officers took Hartigan-Burns home to her partner, Cal, who was a mental health nurse.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: Cal warned police that she was a suicide risk, and police incident logs showed five separate mental health incidents involving Hartigan-Burns in the previous year.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: But instead of using their powers in mental health cases to take Hartigan-Burns to a place of safety, police arrested her for common assault arising from an argument she had had with Cal that evening.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: No consideration was made of her mental health history when she was put in a cell with no CCTV, and she was left on her own when the custody sergeant left two hours early without checking on her.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: His colleagues did not check either until she was found unresponsive in the cell and was taken to hospital where she died.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: June Hartigan, Kelly’s mother, said: “For the last five years we have been tortured by what we knew must have happened, by all the things the police did wrong, and all the ways in which Kelly might have been saved.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: While it helps to hear that the jury could see the same level of wrongdoing, the fact it has taken five years to reach this stage means this is something of a hollow victory.” Deborah Coles, the director of the campaign group Inquest, said: “Kelly was a woman in mental health crisis, in need of care and specialist support, not custody.

Title: Police failed woman who killed herself in Blackburn cell, inquest finds
Line: Police officers treated her distress, vulnerability and suicide risk with reckless indifference.” In the UK and Ireland, Samaritans can be contacted on 116 123 or email jo@samaritans.org or jo@samaritans.ie.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: Platforms that connect buyers and sellers such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to protect consumers from scams, according to the comedian and TV presenter Joe Lycett, who accused them of pocketing the revenue but refusing to take responsibility for fraud.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: The presenter of Channel 4 consumer rights show Joe Lycett’s Got Your Back told peers that regulation, including the introduction of more rigorous checks, should pressure lucrative social media and sales platforms into helping customers who regularly lose thousands of pounds in transactions with fake sellers .

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: Speaking to the House of Lords digital fraud committee, he said: “I think the biggest sector that we think could do better are the platforms.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: “These platforms are often making a lot of money … they should be obliged to do more in that area.” He described the typical response from platforms as: “Well, it’s kind of nothing to do with us, we’ve just offered the platform on which you meet and find these businesses, but if you get scammed it’s nothing to do with us.” Lycett said his TV show’s team had set up a fake account for the chief executive of Airbnb, Brian Chesky, and a fraudulent listing for the Airbnb offices in London.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: “They didn’t check and they didn’t stop it.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: We turned up with the paperwork, and they didn’t like to see us, didn’t let us in,” he said.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: He also criticised banks for failing to protect consumers from increasingly sophisticated scams, citing the example of one woman who lost thousands of pounds after scammers texted her from NatWest’s official phone number, meaning messages arrived within an existing thread with her bank, a scam also replicated in phone calls from legitimate numbers.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: “[NatWest’s] argument was, ‘We can’t stop people pretending to be something they’re not because they were very sophisticated in how they did it,’” he said.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: Many banks have signed up to a voluntary code that reimburses blameless victims who are tricked into transferring money, but critics say this is applied inconsistently.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: Lycett said: “It is kind of at [the banks’] discretion whether they refund their customers who have been scammed.” He added it was a “little bit too easy” to open a bank account without too many questions being asked, and that personal data was widely available online to buy for as little as 20p.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: Lycett also told peers his TV programme would never have been commissioned if Channel 4 had not existed, because most commercial broadcasters would consider it too risky from a legal perspective.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: Asked what he had been most surprised by in the three years since the show started, he said the volume and sophistication of scams, with the cases that appear on the show representing a tiny fraction of the stories the producers receive.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: He added that although the stereotypical scammed victim was an older person less familiar with modern technology, in reality rates were much higher for younger people aged 16 to 34.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams
Line: Complex romantic scams in which victims are groomed over a period of months, such as the fraud depicted in the Netflix series The Tinder Swindler, are also on the rise, he said.

Title: Joe Lycett: sites such as Airbnb and eBay must do more to stop scams

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: One of the classic teen idols of the late 1950s and early 60s, Bobby Rydell, who has died from complications of pneumonia aged 79, was only seven when he began performing on stage in his home town of Philadelphia.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: Over the following 70 years, he would sing everything from rock’n’roll and smoochy love songs to disco, Broadway classics and Italian pop tunes.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: He notched up 19 singles in the Billboard Top 40, among the most successful of them We Got Love, Wild One and Volare.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: It was fitting that his name was chosen for Rydell high school in Grease, the Broadway and later film musical that depicted teenage lives in the early rock’n’roll days of the late 50s.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: If, as a New York Times critic put it, he was “more like a crooner than a rocker”, Rydell’s photogenic looks and endearing personality ensured he would prove far more durable than many flashier, more confrontational artists.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: Rydell and many of his generation were knocked off their pop pedestals by the dramatic arrival of the Beatles and their British counterparts, but he had the staying power of mainstream performers from a slightly earlier generation.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: He was born Robert Ridarelli in Philadelphia, the son of Jennie (nee Sapienza) and Adrio “Al” Ridarelli.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: His father was the foreman in a machine shop.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: Bobby grew up on South 11th Street, and in 1995 his career achievements were recognised by his home city when the street was renamed Bobby Rydell Boulevard.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: There is also a mural of Rydell on the boardwalk of Wildwood, New Jersey, the beach resort that inspired his 1963 hit Wildwood Days.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: His father kindled his musical interest by taking him to see the jazz bands of Artie Shaw and Benny Goodman, and he began playing drums and singing in nightclubs in Philadelphia and New Jersey at the age of seven.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: When he was nine, young Robert won a spot on the television show Paul Whiteman’s TV Teen Club and became a regular cast member.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: After three years on the show, he branched out into performing with local bands, including Rocco and the Saints – in which a fellow Philadelphian, Frankie Avalon, played the trumpet – and changed his name to Rydell.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: After cutting a few unsuccessful singles, Rydell signed to Cameo Records, and made his first appearance on the charts with the exuberant Kissin’ Time (1959).

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: The follow-up, We Got Love, sold a million copies, igniting a streak of hits including Wild One, Swingin’ School, Ding-A-Ling and Volare.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: In 1961, aged 19 and now a confirmed teen heart-throb, he became the youngest performer to headline at the fabled Copacabana club in New York.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: In 1963 he was cast as Hugo Peabody in the film version of the musical Bye Bye Birdie, alongside Ann-Margret and Dick Van Dyke.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: Rydell recalled how the film’s director, George Sidney, “saw some kind of magic between Ann-Margret and myself, and every day that I went back to Columbia Studios, my script got bigger, and bigger, and bigger”.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: He was a regular guest on numerous TV shows, including those hosted by Red Skelton, Jack Benny, Joey Bishop, Perry Como and George Burns.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: “I had the good fortune to spend my peak years as a recording artist during the golden age of the TV variety show,” he wrote in his autobiography, Bobby Rydell: Teen Idol on the Rocks – A Tale of Second Chances (2016).

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: His international reputation was boosted by tours in Europe and others to Australia – where he would tour 20 times – Japan and the far east.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: The Beatles scrambled to meet him when he visited Britain in 1963, and Paul McCartney has said that the Lennon and McCartney song She Loves You was based on a Rydell song, though he did not specify which one (Swingin’ School is a likely candidate).

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: Nonetheless, by 1964 Rydell’s hits were drying up, though he reached No 4 that year with Forget Him, and his generation of performers was sidelined by the seismic impact of the Beatles and the British Invasion.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: His last appearance on Billboard’s Hot 100 was in 1965 with Diana, which reached No 98.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: Even signing a deal with Frank Sinatra’s Reprise label in 1968 could not reverse the slide, with Rydell complaining that Reprise gave him no promotion.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: Rydell could still command enough audience loyalty to tour regularly and appear in nightclubs and Las Vegas venues through the 1970s and 80s, performing the great American songbook of material by the likes of Cole Porter, George Gershwin and Richard Rodgers alongside his repertoire of pop and easy-listening material.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: He enjoyed a further glimmer of chart success with a disco version of his song Sway in 1976.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: In 1985 he joined Avalon and another former teen pop star, Fabian, to form a touring act, the Golden Boys.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: In 2020 he recalled: “I said to Frankie … ‘this is great, but how long is this going to last?

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: A year, two years tops, it’s over.’ Well, that was in 1985, and we’re going on 2021, and we’re still doing the show.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: It’s amazing.” There had been some rocky moments along the way.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: The death of his wife, Camille Quattrone, in 2003, after 35 years of marriage, tipped him into life-threatening alcoholism.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: “Vodka became a very, very dear friend,” he said, “to the point where, a few years later, it led to a double transplant.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: A new liver and a new kidney, because of all the drinking.” He married Linda Hoffman in 2009.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: His alcohol-induced illness forced him to cancel an Australian tour in 2012.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: After transplant surgery, he returned to the stage the following year with three sold-out shows in Las Vegas.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: His career had “had its ups and downs, its peaks and valleys”, he said, “but I’ve survived through all of that, and I continue to do what I really enjoy doing”.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: He is survived by Linda and by two children, Robert and Jennifer, from his first marriage.

Title: Bobby Rydell obituary
Line: • Bobby Rydell (Robert Louis Ridarelli), singer and musician, born 26 April 1942; died 5 April 2022

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: The Co-op Group has warned of continuing problems with food supplies and inflation after revealing that profits more than halved last year amid supply chain disruption and higher staff wages.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: The mutual said underlying profit for 2021, stripping out a one-off £99m gain relating to the sale of the Co-operative Bank in 2017, was down 57% to £100m, compared with the year before, and that sales slipped to £11.2bn, from £11.5bn.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Sales at the group’s food business fell by 2% to £9.1bn despite investing £140m in opening 50 new stores and refitting 87 more, and spending £18m on cutting prices.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: While in-store sales declined, online sales soared from £70m the year before to £200m thanks in part to tie-ups with Deliveroo and Amazon.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Sales also slipped at the Co-op’s funerals business, declining by £8m to £264m.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Shirine Khoury-Haq, the incoming interim chief executive of the Co-op, said: “The last year has seen us facing some significant challenges, including significant supply chain issues in the second half coming at the same time as our food business transformation and increasing inflationary pressures.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: “The difficult operating environment disproportionately impacted our food business, given its focus on the community convenience market, with an operating model that is more reliant on flexibility in the supply chain.” She said the Co-op would be reexamining its current strategy of opening 50 to 100 stores a year as she suspected change would be required given the shift to online shopping and cost challenges.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Khoury-Haq said inflation and supply chain problems were not just being prompted by the war in Ukraine, which has driven up the price of energy and affected supplies of wheat and edible oils.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Even the price of coffins in the group’s funeral business have increased because of global shortages of wood and other resources partly as a result of the pandemic.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Problems with heavy rainfall and flooding in Spain, which supplies large amounts of fresh vegetables to the UK at this time of the year, have also hit supplies of broccoli, courgettes and other vegetables.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Khoury-Haq, who replaces Steve Murrells in May, said the Co-op had been forced to source elsewhere or offer alternatives because of shortages.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: She said some food price increases were “inevitable” this year, but the Co-op was trying to mitigate the problems for customers by not raising the price on 1,000 key items and adding 100 extra products to its budget range.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: The Co-op said it was outperforming the grocery market.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: However, it expected its food business to “face continued challenges during the year” amid “inflationary pressures and the economic uncertainty facing customers”.

Title: Co-op warns about food supplies and inflation as profits fall 57%
Line: Allan Leighton, the chair of the Co-op, said: “The economic headwinds look stark and will be tricky to navigate but through our continued planned strategic investments our Co-op is well placed to ride out the storm and prosper beyond.”

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: If you have looked at Netflix over the past few days, there is an overwhelming chance that you will have been bashed over the head by a weird-looking Japanese documentary.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: No matter what your viewing history is – whether you prefer Bridgerton or Stranger Things, Breaking Bad or second world war documentaries – there it is.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Floating in multicoloured bubble letters, devoid of any context whatsoever, is the title Old Enough.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Which begs the question: what the hell is Old Enough?

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Unfortunately, the initial explanation is even more confusing than Netflix’s aggressive push.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Old Enough is the wildly popular Japanese show Hajimete no Otsukai (My First Errand), an entertainment documentary show where toddlers are sent out into the world completely alone, to go shopping or navigate public transport.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: In Japan, Old Enough has been airing for 30 years, with two three-hour shows broadcast each year.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: When it airs, a fifth of all Japanese viewers tune in.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: It’s a true phenomenon.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: The length between episodes can be explained by the sheer level of preparation that goes into each task.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: All the errand routes are inspected by parents and production staff, to check for dangerous roads or “suspicious persons”.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: The children are chosen after a laborious selection process, the camera crew and safety team are given hiding places so the kids won’t spot them and all the local neighbours are informed of the task, so as not to freak out and call the police when they see a four-year-old wandering aimlessly through the streets.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Part of the appeal, from what I can tell, is the show’s ability to instil confidence into the children.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: They’re all aged between two and six years old, and they’re almost always scared to death when they first set out.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Rightly so, because walking a mile to a shop alone can be a terrifying prospect for a toddler.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: However, the big heartwarming punch that usually comes at the end is a newfound pride in their abilities.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: The kids had an adventure, and they weren’t helped, and they did it.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: So that’s what Old Enough is.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Netflix’s aggressive stance on shoving it at the top of everyone’s homepage is harder to explain.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: The arrival of Old Enough was greeted with a flurry of press releases from the Japanese broadcaster Nippon, hailing a partnership with Netflix for 30 of its shows.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Whether those shows – including Death Note, Your Turn to Kill and Life’s Punchline – will be given the same attention remains to be seen.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Now for the big question: is Old Enough any good?

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: The answer is a resounding “sort of”.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: The good news is that the Netflix versions are much shorter than the original programmes.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: These are all less than 20 minutes long, rather than three hours.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: It is a resoundingly sweet show.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: For the most part, you can’t help but root for the children.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: In the first episode, a very young boy walks to the supermarket to pick up three items, narrating his adventure to himself as he goes.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Later on in the series, we see a young girl attempt an errand, only to rush back to her mother in tears after getting lost before overcoming her nerves and setting out again.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: It is an absolute rollercoaster of emotions that leaves you in tatters, and you suspect this is why it has such a dedicated following in Japan.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: That said, this is a very Japanese show, in terms of concept and execution.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Japanese words continually pop up onscreen in cartoonish font, and each onscreen action is accompanied by what sounds like canned laughter or applause, which can be off-putting.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport
Line: Either way, if you think Old Enough is inescapable now, just wait.

Title: Old Enough: the Japanese TV show that abandons toddlers on public transport

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: More than 1,500 book bans have been instituted in US school districts in the last nine months, a study has found, part of a rightwing censorship effort described as “unparalleled in its intensity”.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: PEN America, a non-profit organization that works to protect freedom of expression in the US, scrutinized efforts to ban certain books from school libraries for its “Banned in the USA” report.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: The organization found that 1,145 books were targeted by rightwing politicians and activists, including the work of the Nobel prize laureate Toni Morrison.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: The report shows the striking impact of the ongoing effort by conservatives to censor literature in schools.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: The bans have largely targeted books that focus on race and LGBTQ issues, and a large number of the banned books are written by non-white or LGBTQ authors.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: PEN America tallied efforts between 1 July 2021 and 31 March this year, in what it said was the first “book by book, district by district account of what books are being banned, where in the country, and through what procedures”.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: It found that 1,586 bans were implemented in 86 school districts across 26 states.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: “This type of data has never been tallied and quite frankly the results are shocking,” said Jonathan Friedman, director of PEN America’s Free Expression and Education.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: “Challenges to books, specifically books by non-white male authors, are happening at the highest rates we’ve ever seen.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: What is happening in this country in terms of banning books in schools is unparalleled in its frequency, intensity and success.” The data confirms that was a specific theme to the book bans.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: Of the banned titles, 41% included “protagonists or prominent secondary characters” who were people of color, according to PEN America.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: About 22% of the banned books “directly address issues of race and racism”, while 33% “explicitly address LGBTQ+ themes, or have protagonists or prominent secondary characters who are LGBTQ+”.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: PEN America found that the three most frequently banned titles all are centered on LGBTQ+ individuals, “or touch on the topic of same-sex relationships”.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: Gender Queer: A Memoir by Maia Kobabe has been banned in 30 school districts, while All Boys Aren’t Blue by George M Johnson and Lawn Boy by Jonathan Evison are also among the most targeted.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: Out of Darkness by Ashley Hope Pérez, a novel about a romance between a Black teenage boy and a Mexican American girl, has been banned in 16 districts, and The Bluest Eye, the story of a young Black girl’s experiences in 1940s America by Toni Morrison, has been banned in 12 districts.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: “This is an orchestrated attack on books whose subjects only recently gained a foothold on school library shelves and in classrooms,” Friedman said.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: “We are witnessing the erasure of topics that only recently represented progress toward inclusion.” The book censorship has been matched by a wave of rightwing legislation dictating what teachers can and cannot discuss in schools.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: In March Florida passed a bill dubbed “don’t say gay”, which forbids “instruction” on sexual orientation and gender identity in kindergarten through third grade.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: Some states have also banned discussion of the modern-day impact of historical racism in the US – an issue that has become a hobby horse for Republicans at state and national level.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: The censorship has frequently been pushed by conservative groups linked to deep-pocketed rightwing donors.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: Groups like Moms for Liberty and Parents Defending Education have been instrumental in book-banning attempts in the US, often presenting themselves as small, “grassroots” efforts, while in reality they have links to prominent, wealthy Republicans.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: There is, however, some evidence that the efforts to censor literature that focuses on race and LGBTQ issues are having the opposite effect.

Title: ‘Unparalleled in intensity’ – 1,500 book bans in US school districts.
Line: “Banned book clubs”, where children and young adults meet to read and discuss titles that have been censored by school districts, have sprung up across America, while sales of the book Maus, a Pulitzer prize-winning graphic novel about the Holocaust, soared in January after it was banned by a Tennessee school board.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: It has taken until now for Mitsuko Uchida to lay down a recording of Beethoven’s Diabelli Variations.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: This colossal work, which grew out of a publisher’s request for one single variation on a fairly naff little tune, encapsulates so many of Beethoven’s contradictions – and Uchida, so adept at putting across music’s humour without diminishing its depth, is made for it.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: Her playing conveys a keen sense of the music’s absurdities without exaggerating its quirks, gently raising an eyebrow at Beethoven’s passages of deliberate heavy-footedness and revealing that there is always a sincere, profound truth right behind them.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: It’s not so much that her sudden changes of inflection turn the music itself around, more that she lets us see through things to what’s waiting behind.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: At the start, the theme bounces and bumbles along, with the downward scales at the end of each phrase jumping out at us just a little, as if the music is saying it might be up for a joke later.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: But in the first variation, by stressing each long chord slightly in a way that makes the music sound like it’s puffing up to the top of the keyboard, Uchida simultaneously introduces and skewers the pomposity that informs so many of the variations to come – something that dissolves, temporarily but instantly, in the delicacy of the next variation.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: And so it continues, with a constant thread tying the variations together through so many jack-knife changes of mood.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: Variation 20 sounds fascinating, all strangely modern-sounding harmonies in search of a melody; two variations later, Beethoven quotes the melody sung by Leporello in Mozart’s Don Giovanni grumbling about working night and day – was he getting fed up, or was he on a roll?

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: – and the clarity and dexterity of Uchida’s playing here is a delight.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: Beethoven ends his variations, as he began, with a dance – but this delicately wrought yet expansive minuet is to that stomping little opening tune as a butterfly is to a caterpillar.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: In Uchida’s quietly poised hands it is at once the culmination of an entertainingly roundabout journey and the opening-up of a whole new vista.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this

Line: Here are two bafflingly neglected piano trios in gloriously vibrant performances.

Title: Diabelli Variations review – Uchida’s unparalleled playing is made for this
Line: If you’ve ever wished there was more chamber music to discover by Brahms and Robert Schumann, this is a real treat.
