Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 20 Moderation (2019) “Do I look moderate to you?” asks the never-knowingly subtle Florence Welch rhetorically on this James Ford-produced one-off single.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Opening with bar-room piano stabs, it soon blossoms into a galloping rocker, Welch battling an inner voice suggesting she perhaps rein it in.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Needless to say she doesn’t listen.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 19 Wish That You Were Here (2016) Welch’s windswept wail and penchant for atmospheric harp flutters have made her catnip for fantastical film soundtracks.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: On this undulating, near seven-minute epic, taken from Tim Burton’s Miss Peregrine’s Home for Peculiar Children, Welch mourns relationships fractured by constant touring.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: “I wanted to go home, to be where you are,” she roars as drums crash like angry waves.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 18 Big God (2018) On 2018’s fourth album High As Hope, Welch and her evolving studio cohorts (the more static ‘+ the Machine’ are for live shows) sought to dial down the bluster.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: On the experimental, relatively stripped back Big God – co-written by Jamie xx – Welch prowls around a loping piano figure, before a meandering sax solo from Kamasi Washington slowly takes over.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 17 Never Let Me Go (2011) After the ubiquitous success of debut album Lungs, Welch fast-tracked its follow-up Ceremonials, decamping to Abbey Road studios with producer Paul Epworth.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: While Lungs skipped around genres mischievously, the opulent Ceremonials focused more on widescreen chamber pop, with the Halo-esque Never Let Me Go a prime example of refined excess.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 16 Sky Full of Song (2018) High As Hope’s lead single feels like a soft caress in comparison to the usual cold, hard slap of a big chart-facing hit.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Lyrically it ponders the paradox of performing live, exploring the huge highs that only temporarily pierce moments of strange isolation.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: “I thought I was flying but maybe I’m dying tonight,” Welch sings softly over distant harp flutters.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 15 Drumming Song (2009) While her early pop contemporaries Lily Allen and Adele turned relationships into soap operas and kitchen-sink dramas, Welch spun them into gothic fantasies.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: On Lungs’ propulsive fourth single, a new crush elicits the kind of high-wire emotions more akin to drowning, an exhausted Welch left “as empty as that beating drum”.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 14 What the Water Gave Me (2011) Named after Frida Kahlo’s 1938 painting, Ceremonials’ more rock-leaning promotional single (AKA the one before the proper single), finds Welch returning to a lyrical trope; trying to understand the vastness of something too enormous to understand.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Here she is overwhelmed by bodies of water, a place both beautiful and deadly.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 13 South London Forever (2018) Created at the start of her 30s, High As Hope excels when Welch looks back at her youth with misty-eyed clarity.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Over airy production, here she half-remembers nights spent holding hands with strangers “high on E”, and relishes in the false certainty of “it doesn’t get better than this”.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Later, as the song starts to wrestle with itself, Welch snaps: “Oh God, what do I know?” 12 King (2022) Around the two-minute 45 seconds mark of this first single from next month’s Dance Fever, Welch unleashes an almighty, wordless roar, as if making it very clear that High As Hope’s sonic retreat was an anomaly.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: From there the song keeps building, like a raging fire fuelled by the opening verse’s slow burn anger at societal expectations placed on women.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 11 Sweet Nothing (2012) In 2012, Welch dipped her toe in EDM’s WKD-coloured waters not once but twice, with Calvin Harris first sending a remix of Ceremonials’ Spectrum to No 1.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Three months later she was back with Harris at the top on this gloriously sugary confection, Welch sounding as if she’s having the time of her life while Harris unleashes a rapid-fire electronic blitzkrieg around her.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 10 Dog Days Are Over (2008) Like most songs on Lungs, this single’s appeal has been dampened slightly by its ubiquity.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: There was a time in 2010 where you couldn’t shop, watch TV or wander around a festival field without hearing its opening harp trills, or that thumping chorus.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Still, taken at a distance, it remains a glorious head-rush of emotions, Welch barely keeping up with its galloping ecstasy.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 9 No Light, No Light (2011) A lot of second album Ceremonials teeters on the brink of self-parody, with everything turned up to 11.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: On the sky-scraping No Light, No Light, Welch revels in the OTT, swishing around cascading choirs and harps before ditching her highfalutin lyrical tropes in favour of direct emotion: “Would you leave me if I told you what I’d done?” she asks during the song’s majestic bridge.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 8 My Love (2022) New album Dance Fever’s latest single finds Welch trying to find inspiration in a world locked down (“my arms emptied, the skies emptied” she panics in the song’s finale).

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: What started as an acoustic “sad little poem” has been buffed by Glass Animals’ Dave Bayley into a pensive banger, all propulsive dance rhythms and tentative exaltation.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 7 What Kind of Man (2015) By third album How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful, Welch et al had reached festival headline status, a fact underlined months later at Glastonbury.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: On the album’s combative lead single, the pretty harp flourishes of old are swapped for rugged guitar riffs, with Welch utilising distinctly masculine rock tropes to admonish a useless man.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 6 Shake It Out (2011) In 2011, Florence + the Machine were big enough to be handed a coveted performance slot on The X Factor, a nod to Welch’s vocal influence on a plethora of “kooky” young hopefuls.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: They performed this maximalist baroque pop rager, which finds Welch trying to shake an almighty hangover by exorcising it from her body by sheer force alone.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 5 Cosmic Love (2009) Another song created on a hangover, Lungs’ sixth single takes a classic subject – being really really in love – and straps it to a rocket aimed at the moon.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: There is not an ounce of subtlety on display here (its firework-esque harp coda is joined by the sound of actual fireworks, for example), which only makes its youthful, cartwheeling exuberance all the more accurate.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 4 St Jude (2015) Across How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful’s 11 tracks, Welch invokes various characters, from Persephone to the Virgin Mary.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: On the delicate St Jude, which strips everything back to Welch’s pin-sharp voice and a distant electronic rumble, she references both the “patron saint of the lost causes” and the 2013 storm that shared her name.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Somewhere in the middle sits perhaps her most genuinely affecting song.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 3 Rabbit Heart (Raise It Up) (2009) Written at the behest of her label, who asked Welch for something more upbeat to balance out Lungs’ darker fare, Rabbit Heart bristles with the fear that comes with reaching the point of no return.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Aware she was about to dive into fame’s chasm, the song’s lyrics abound with sacrificial imagery (“Who is the lamb and who is the knife?”), all wrapped up in sprightly production that gave the band their first proper hit.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 2 Hunger (2018) Written initially as a private poem, High As Hope’s second single strips away any artifice and explores Welch’s relationship with drink and drugs (she’s been sober since 2014), and her teenage eating disorder.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: “At 17 I started to starve myself,” she sings, a bracing opening that’s soon warmed by the chorus’ light-footed melody and Welch’s sage reflections on the complex beauty of “vibrant youth”.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: 1 Ship to Wreck (2015) While making How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful, Welch has said producer Markus Dravs told her to stop writing songs about water.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Thankfully, she ignored him, with the album’s lead single – a galloping mix of acoustic guitar, hammond organ and glockenspiel – likening a broken relationship to a battered ship being washed up on the shore.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Throughout Welch conjures up images of great white sharks and killer whales to represent her demons, continuing her philosophy of never writing small songs about big emotions.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: By the glorious middle eight, Welch’s propensity for self-destruction has fully taken hold: “We are lost, and into the breach, we got tossed,” she sings, “And the water is coming in fast”.

Title: Florence + the Machine’s 20 best songs – ranked!
Line: Ruin never sounded so wonderful.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: Labour has called for clarity over why Rishi Sunak’s wife, Akshata Murty, uses non-domicile status, as Keir Starmer said it would be “breathtaking hypocrisy” if she had been reducing her tax liabilities while the chancellor was raising taxes on others.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: Murty receives about £11.5m in annual dividends from a stake in her family’s IT business empire, Infosys, which is headquartered in Bengaluru, India, and listed on the Indian and New York stock exchanges.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: Under UK tax laws, Murty’s status as a non-dom means she does not have to pay tax on dividend payments from overseas companies.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: As of Wednesday, UK resident taxpayers in the highest income band pay a 39.35% tax on dividend payouts.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: After her status was revealed by the Independent a spokesperson for Murty said that because she was a citizen of India, which does not allow Indians to hold the citizenship of another country simultaneously, she “is treated as non-domiciled for UK tax purposes”.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: They added: “She has always and will continue to pay UK taxes on all her UK income.” However, tax experts have said non-dom status is not automatic but a choice.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: Prof Richard Murphy, a Sheffield University academic who co-founded the Tax Justice Network, said: “Domicile has nothing to do with a person’s nationality.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: In other words, the claims made in the statement issued by Ms Murty are wrong, and as evidence, just because a person has Indian citizenship will never automatically grant them non-dom status in the UK.” The Labour MP Chris Bryant said the statement needed to be clarified: “This is just wrong.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: Non-dom status is not automatic and the Treasury needs to urgently clarify this inaccurate statement.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: “After shutting down legitimate questions about Infosys and its operations in Russia last week, it’s time for Rishi Sunak to come clean.” Starmer said Sunak “has very, very serious questions to answer”.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: The Labour leader told Sky News that Sunak had repeatedly raised taxes: “He says all of this is necessary, there’s no option.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status
Line: If it now transpires that his wife has been using schemes to reduce her own tax, then I’m afraid that is breathtaking hypocrisy.

Title: Labour says Rishi Sunak must ‘come clean’ about wife’s non-dom tax status

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: Boris Johnson’s new energy strategy could take up to five years to start shaving money off people’s bills, the business secretary has admitted, as the prime minister announced a drastic expansion of nuclear reactors.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: Kwasi Kwarteng said the plan for cutting reliance on imported energy in the wake of spiralling prices caused in part by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine was more of a medium-term way to ramp up homegrown energy production.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: Johnson declared that the long-delayed energy security strategy meant “nuclear is coming home” – but the review declined to set targets for onshore wind and committed to continuing the exploitation of North Sea oil and gas.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: Days after 22 million people were hit by the energy price cap rising by 54%, Kwarteng suggested it would be years until the benefits of the strategy would be felt by consumers.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: “The strategy is more of a medium-term three, four, five-year answer,” the business secretary told Sky News.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: “I think it’s really important that we get an energy strategy that means we can have more security and independence in the years ahead.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: “We want to have security of supply, we want to live in a world where we’re not dependent on what Russian policy is, but we have more control over energy sources here in Britain.” The cost of offshore wind had decreased enormously in the past 10 years, Kwarteng said, adding: “Some of these benefits can happen quite quickly.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: But we need to start the planning process and the strategy now.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: And that’s what this security strategy is all about.” The chancellor, Rishi Sunak, attempted to intervene in the cost of living crisis at the end of March, but was accused of not doing enough to help struggling households expected to face the biggest fall in living standards since modern records began in the 1950s.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: At the heart of this week’s energy strategy was nuclear, and a commitment by the government to more than triple the amount of nuclear energy generated so that 25% of all Britain’s electricity comes from atomic energy.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: In a social media video to promote the strategy, Johnson said: “In the country that was the first to split the atom, the first truly to harness its power to light our homes and drive our factories, we will once again lead the way.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: “Nuclear is coming home.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: So instead of a new reactor every decade we will have a new reactor every year.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: Ed Miliband, the shadow business secretary, said a significant majority of people supported onshore wind.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: Pat McFadden, the shadow Treasury chief secretary, also said Kwarteng’s comments about the time it would take for the energy strategy to start to bring down energy bills showed the government had “no plan to immediately address their cost of living crisis”.

Title: UK’s energy strategy may take years to bring down bills, says Kwarteng
Line: He reiterated Labour’s call for a one-off windfall tax on “the booming profits of oil and gas giants – which would reduce household bills by up to £600”.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: By 11am on opening day at Portland’s The Sports Bra, billed as the world’s first sports bar showing only women’s sports, a bustling queue had already filled the sidewalk.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: While members of the Pride Cheerleading Association shook pompoms in the parking lot, dozens of women – fans and athletes alike – waited to grab a seat and reach a milestone together.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “I actually got emotional and cried when I walked in,” said Leslie Melin, who sat at the bar with a signature cocktail.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “I’m so proud to be here.” The Sports Bra, which opened its doors in Oregon on 1 April, seeks to address a glaring gender imbalance in sports coverage.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Although 40% of professional athletes are female, women’s sports make up only 4% of all sports media coverage, according to a Unesco study on gender equality.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “Our approach is to take that 4% that is showing and put it on blast,” said Jenny Nguyen, the bar’s founder and owner.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: That message resonated with those who showed up for the kick-off.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Jamie Orr – one of hundreds of backers who raised more than $100,000 on The Sports Bra’s Kickstarter campaign – made history by becoming its first customer.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “To have a sports bar where you’re not going to have to fight to get the back TV turned on to a women’s game, it’s just great,” she said.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “Hardly anyone knows the history of women’s football,” said Leah Hinkle, general manager of the Oregon Ravens, a team of the Women’s National Football Conference, whose games will be streamed at The Sports Bra.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “But equity isn’t just about divvying up screen time,” added Hinkle.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “Equity is about having what you need to succeed.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Women’s sports need a movement and The Sports Bra is making a statement.” The statement starts with five television screens, mounted on walls adorned with framed jerseys and memorabilia from a swath of women’s teams.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: The bar has partnered with ESPN3 and media company Just Women’s Sports to stream a variety of programming, from games to original content.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: And during times when there are no women’s sports to broadcast or stream, the bar plans to turn the TVs off, to highlight the lack of coverage.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “We use that weakness as a talking point to draw attention to it,” Nguyen said.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “I would love to play 24-7 women’s sports in here, but it’s just not possible.” Opening weekend offered a host of matches, from pro golf to college softball.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: The bar also showed two games of the NCAA’s March Madness, the first since Sedona Prince’s viral TikTok video highlighted shocking inequality between men’s and women’s weights rooms, leading to an equity review and a host of changes at the college basketball tournament.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: For Sivan Nadler, head of strategy at Just Women’s Sports, Nguyen’s concept gets to the heart of the matter.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “There is a lot of language and marketing linked to empowerment and social good around women’s sports,” said Nadler.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “And both of those things are important, but there’s not enough about the fact that these women are ballers.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: We want to see them play.” The seeds of The Sports Bra were planted four years ago when Nguyen and some friends watched a killer NCAA women’s championship at a local bar, on mute.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Afterwards, Nguyen made an off-the-cuff remark: “You know, the only time we’re ever going to be able to watch a women’s game, with the sound on and all the fanfare, is if we had our own space.” A few days later she came up with the name and a cheeky slogan followed: We support women.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Yet for years, The Sports Bra would remain a running joke among Nguyen and her friends.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Whenever they found themselves frustrated by the lack of representation of women’s sports, they’d return to the safe space in their imagination and curate a playlist of games and even menu ideas.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Eventually, as Nguyen faced a period of personal frustration marked by the Covid-19 pandemic and George Floyd’s murder, her girlfriend suggested she turn her dream of The Sports Bra into a reality.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: It was a risk, as droves of bars and restaurants were shuttered during lockdown, while new businesses were competing to snatch up hot real estate from the ashes.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Rejected by the banks, Nguyen persevered with Kickstarter pledges and seed funding from friends and family.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Food is an important part of the bar’s identity, and Nguyen’s too.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: It saved her life, so to speak, when her athletic career ended abruptly after she ruptured her ACL playing college basketball.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Devastated, she turned to cooking and for the next 15 years worked her way up through Portland’s renowned culinary scene.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: The Sports Bra menu contains traditional pub grub with vegan-friendly options that uplift Nguyen’s Vietnamese heritage, including her mother’s famous clay-pot pork ribs and her aunt’s glazed chicken wings.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Its message carries over to its vendors, sourcing beef, beverages and produce from women-owned companies in the community.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Even its cocktails give a wink to women’s sports, including a gin drink called “Triple Axel” – a salute to Portland’s own Tonya Harding.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Fixing the gender problem in sports coverage is bigger than simply opening a bar, but Nguyen hopes their mission can make a dent, one game at a time.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Experts say building visibility is a key part of increasing young women’s participation in sports.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: According to the Women’s Sports Foundation, by the time a girl reaches 14 years of age, she’s twice as likely to drop out of sports compared with a boy.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: And if she’s LGBTQ+ or a person of color, the dropout rates double.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: It’s one reason why The Sports Bra is allowing minors into the space.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: Nguyen hopes that in the coming years, there might even be potential to franchise and expand.

Title: Cheers, drinks and tears: opening day at the bar where women’s sports reign
Line: “I think that by giving women’s sports fans a physical location to celebrate, we can show the general public and mainstream media that there’s huge potential for growth and investment in women’s sports.”

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: Big cities in California spent large portions of their federal Covid relief money on police departments, a review of public records has revealed, with several cities prioritizing police funding by a wide margin.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: As part of the American Rescue Plan Act (Arpa), the Biden administration’s signature stimulus package, the US government sent funds to cities to help them fight coronavirus and support local recovery efforts.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: The money, officials said, could be used to fund a range of services, including public health and housing initiatives, healthcare workers’ salaries, infrastructure investments and aid for small businesses.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: But most large California cities spent millions of Arpa dollars on law enforcement.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: Some also gave police money from the Coronavirus Aid, Relief and Economic Security (Cares) Act, adopted in 2020 under Donald Trump.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: The records show: San Francisco received $312m in Arpa funds for fiscal year 2020 and allocated 49% ($153m) to police, 13% ($41m) to the sheriff’s department, and the remainder to the fire department, according to the city controller.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: San Francisco also gave roughly 22% ($38.5m) of its Cares funds to law enforcement.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: Los Angeles spent roughly 50% of its first round of Arpa relief funds on the LAPD, according to a public records request by the controller candidate Kenneth Mejia, and first reported in local news site LA Taco.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: Fresno spent $36.6m of its Cares funds on the police, making up 67% of Cares spending on city salaries, and roughly 40% of all of Fresno’s Cares funds.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: San Jose allocated roughly $27.8m of its Cares and Arpa funds to police salaries and the police dispatch department, representing about 12% of its relief money.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: Long Beach allocated the majority of its $135.8 million Arpa funds to police, though a spokesperson said a detailed breakdown of funds was not available.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: Oakland allocated $5m (13.5%) of its Cares funds to police salaries; Sacramento allocated $2.2m (2.5%) of Cares funds to police; and San Diego spent roughly $60.1m (64%) of its Cares funds on police in fiscal year 2020, and $52.6m (33%) in fiscal year 2021.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: The budgeting and reporting process varies by city and is often opaque, making it difficult to compare and analyze how governments prioritized police and executed their budgets.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: In Fresno, the city allocated more than double of its Cares money to police than it did to Covid testing, contact tracing, small business grants, childcare vouchers and transitional housing combined.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police
Line: Oakland’s police allocation was greater than the amounts spent on a housing initiative, a small business grant program and a workforce initiative.

Title: California cities spent huge share of federal Covid relief funds on police

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis
Line: Sea levels have risen about 9in since 1880, with one-third of that gain from the last 25 years alone.

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis
Line: Every year, a flurry of reports are published warning of the risk to towns and cities along coastal areas.

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis
Line: It’s one thing to hear about a looming disaster; it’s another to see the cataclysm play out in real time.

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis
Line: That’s what’s happening in Taholah, a village on Washington’s coast that acts as the capital for the Quinault Indian Nation, a tribe of about 3,600 members.

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis
Line: In Taholah, climate change-caused sea level rise has brought to the community a fast receding shoreline, and with it a heightened threat of flooding: according to Quinault estimates, the ocean level could increase by 2.6ft by 2100, pushing storm surges higher and bringing waves closer to town.

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis
Line: On an overcast February morning, Larry Ralston, the 62-year-old treasurer of the Quinault Nation, drove his silver Ford SUV down a network of Taholah’s unmarked gravel roads, telling me about what this place used to look like, before climate change permanently reconfigured the landscape.

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis

Title: ‘It’s happening now’: how rising sea levels are causing a US migration crisis

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: Coltun, bassist in Mdou Moctar’s backing trio, was right.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: Anyone inclined to take Nigerien guitarist Moctar or his band at face value will be disabused of the “world music” notion as soon as they start to play.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: In calf-length Tuareg robes and turban-like white tagelmusts, they passionately shred and lock into psychedelic grooves.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: Singing in the Tuareg language Tamasheq, Moctar rewrites the guitar-hero rulebook: lesson one is that surging guitar music marinated in the African/American folk fusion known as desert blues is rock.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: Ostensibly here to promote the resoundingly praised current album, Afrique Victime, Moctar – “the Hendrix of the Sahara”, as he’s been tagged – is the type who needs no excuse to unpack his white left-handed Stratocaster and play.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: In an inversion of the usual rock star entrance, the 38-year-old even arrives on stage before his band, who amble on a few minutes later.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: The four are quickly immersed in the 2017 track Amidini, which proceeds from delicately finger-picked opening bars to psych-drone.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: Next, Kamane Tarhanin explains the many comparisons to Eddie Van Halen.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: New Yorker Coltun, the lone American in the group, has said that moshpits and crowd-surfing often break out at their shows, and we find out why: when Moctar slides into a melodic pattern and the others fall in step with him, creating layer on thrusting layer of noise at stunning speed, the urge to hurl yourself at another person arises.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero
Line: Packed in shoulder-to-shoulder, tonight’s crowd have to make do with vigorous body-shaking.

Title: Mdou Moctar review – passionate shredding by Nigerien guitar hero

Title: Thieving sea lions break into salmon farm and gorge on feast of fish
Line: Dozens of thieving sea lions in western Canada have spent the last few weeks gorging on fish after brazenly slipping into an industrial salmon farm – and ignoring all attempts to make them move on.

Title: Thieving sea lions break into salmon farm and gorge on feast of fish
Line: Cermaq, the aquaculture giant with operations in Norway, Chile and Canada, says the wily predators were able to evade netting and electric fences in late March as part of a “breach event” at the Rant Point farm near Tofino in British Columbia.

Title: Thieving sea lions break into salmon farm and gorge on feast of fish
Line: Local conservation groups, who oppose the fish farms and only learned of the breach on Sunday, have warned the sea lions themselves are in danger the longer they spend inside the farm.

Title: Thieving sea lions break into salmon farm and gorge on feast of fish
Line: “We witnessed the sea lion going over one of the fences jumping right into a ‘bird net’, which is suspended net above the pens.

Title: Thieving sea lions break into salmon farm and gorge on feast of fish
Line: “There’s a lot of ropes and hoses around, so we’re increasingly concerned about entanglement.” In little more than a decade, more than 100 sea lions have drowned after getting tangled in fish farm nets, as has one humpback whale, highlighting the dangers the farms and their nets pose to local wildlife.

Title: Thieving sea lions break into salmon farm and gorge on feast of fish
Line: Efforts to scare the sea lions away, including with loud noises, have so far failed.

Title: Thieving sea lions break into salmon farm and gorge on feast of fish

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: An artwork recognising almost 1,000 women and children killed by men in Australia has been removed from a Melbourne museum, partly on the grounds it could traumatise some visitors.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: Melbourne artist Dans Bain was asked on Wednesday to remove her 30 metre work, The Lost Petition, from the Her Place Women’s Museum before Friday’s opening of an exhibition celebrating 25 years of women in politics, curated by the Australian Labor party-affiliated network Emily’s List.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: According to a statement issued by the chair of the Her Place Women’s Museum board, Mary Delahunty, The Lost Petition was taken down because of the work’s size and scale, and the lack of an alternative space to install it in the east Melbourne museum.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: But Emily’s List national co-convenor Leigh Svendsen confirmed to the Guardian the organisation had asked the museum’s board to have the artwork removed, partly out of concern that there were insufficient measures in place for people who might be triggered by the work’s confronting nature.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “It’s a fantastic exhibit, but we only have volunteers to staff the Her Story exhibition, we certainly haven’t any capacity or ability to support people if they become upset by Dans’ work,” Svendsen said.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “I’m not suggesting that that would necessarily happen [but] I think that’s something that needs to be taken into consideration.” The Lost Petition fabric artwork consists of 12 white bedsheets stitched together and bears the names of 986 women and children murdered through domestic violence since 2008.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: As more deaths occur, their names are added to the work.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: The artist said the Emily’s List request to remove her work was like a “double erasure” of the women and children who had already had their lives snatched away.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “I’ve had families contact me and asked for photos – I had learned just recently, a family from New Zealand, their mother is on the list, and the family asked me to take photos,” Bain told the Guardian.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “I had to say, unfortunately, we’ve had to remove it from public viewing.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: And it just feels awful that we’re doing that to families.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “This work is about bringing visibility to this issue of male violence against women and children and I’m pretty devastated that these lives have now been doubly erased because it’s been decided The Lost Petition is an uncomfortable reality.” The names of the victims inscribed on the artwork are provided by the founder of the anti-gendered violence group the Red Heart Campaign, Sherele Moody, who said the work’s removal was an “uncaring slap in the face” for the families of every victim named on the artwork.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “I know some people hate this artwork because it tells an uncomfortable truth about violence in Australia,” she said.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “But to see a museum for women and another high profile women’s organisation deem it inappropriate is massive kick in the guts for me and for Dans.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “Saying now is not the time to hang this project shows how dead women and kids are an inconvenience to even those who should know better.” Delahunty’s statement issued on Thursday said the museum board had made the decision to reinstall the artwork later in the year, in agreement with the artist.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “We are planning to welcome The Lost Petition back to Her Place Museum later in the year as a focus of the Her Voice program of Australian Women’s activism, after May when The Lost Petition will tour regionally,” she said.

Title: ‘Doubly erased’: artwork recording names of domestic violence victims removed from Melbourne museum
Line: “It is a powerful artwork and that power is reflected in the feedback we have received.”

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: This August, tens of millions of Africans will turn their attention to Kenya’s general election.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Kenya’s recent history features hotly contested, sometimes violent elections in which candidates and their allies have used tribal politics to turn people against one another.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Yet as this election approaches, one of the biggest dangers comes much further from home: US and Chinese tech platforms.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Before unpacking the dangerous role that tech platforms are playing in Kenya, it’s important to understand the high stakes.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: For many Kenyans, this is the mother of all elections.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: The country’s president, Uhuru Kenyatta of the Jubilee party, has overseen an economy battered by inflation and debt, bruised by corruption and struggling to get on its feet due to the harm inflicted by Covid.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Fighting to be the next president are Kenyatta’s deputy, William Ruto, and the leader of the opposition, Raila Odinga, of the Orange Democratic Movement (ODM).

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: The last time Kenyatta and Ruto were on opposing sides of an election, in 2007 and 2008, the country was plagued by violence, and they ended up on trial in the international criminal court (ICC).

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: (Kenyatta’s charges were dropped in December 2014, and the court terminated Ruto’s case due to weak evidence.) Essential discussions about the election are unfolding on platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, and TikTok.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: It’s on these platforms that crucial civic information – but also disinformation and hate speech – will be amplified.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Meanwhile, Kenya receives just a fraction of the resources – if that – that platforms give to address similar issues in western elections.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: They have acquired a massive civic responsibility in our countries – one that they are having trouble accepting.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: These platforms already have an unpleasant history of abetting election disinformation across Kenya.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: In 2013 and 2017, Kenyatta’s campaigns used Cambridge Analytica to create election branding and messaging that critics called “divisive propaganda” that inflamed ethnic tensions.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Similarly, Google ran poisonous attack ads under the banner “The Real Raila” on its search and YouTube products from Harris Media – a Texas-based rightwing media company that was also hired by Trump during his 2016 campaigns.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Now it’s happening all over again.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: In the past few months, work I published with Mozilla reported how Twitter’s complacency has allowed for the development of a thriving disinformation industry in Kenya, comprised of influencers-for-hire who sell their services on the platform to politicians and political groups.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: This industry has repeatedly been used by various problematic actors to consolidate power and neutralise public outcry, from lawmakers (or their proxies) to political groups abroad.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: For example, in 2021 Kenyan judges and activists underwent wave after wave of attacks on Twitter as Kenyatta and Odinga sought to get their elite pact, titled Building Bridges Initiative (BBI), past the courts.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Further investigations found that the same shady industry attempted to neutralise public outcry after Kenyatta was implicated in Africa Uncensored’s Pandora Papers revelations (along with other news organisations worldwide) in late 2021.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: (Kenyatta said the papers “would go a long way in enhancing financial transparency required in Kenya”, but never responded to his presence in the documents.) It doesn’t stop there.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Rightwing political organisations in places such as Spain have been using platforms to meddle with Kenyans’ civic debate online.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: The Spanish organisation CitizenGO ran campaigns over the past few years that Twitter amplified through its trending algorithm to millions of Kenyans in an attempt to oust politicians who support progressive legislation.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Meanwhile, allegations about Facebook’s moderation efforts in Africa dim any optimism that big tech companies might learn from past failures.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Time recently reported on the alleged poor pay and working conditions of Facebook’s content moderators in Kenya.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Moderators claimed that speed was prioritised over all else, including health.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: There are many criticisms that Facebook content moderators around the world are treated poorly, but the low pay and poor conditions in Africa are especially stark.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: African moderators accused Meta and Sama (Meta’s moderation subcontractor) of discrimination and rights abuses after the working conditions left many of them with PTSD.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Since the revelations came to light Meta and Sama have been served with legal letters for breaking multiple sections of Kenya’s labour laws.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Such a situation means that hate speech and incitement will continue to run rampant on the platform.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Disinformation has been allowed to fester in east Africa, especially when compared to regions like North America and western Europe.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: This is evidence of two larger problems.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: The first is US tech platforms’ context bias in Africa.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: US platforms and the people who run them – most of whom are based in California – simply don’t know the histories and norms of African democracy.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Secondly, platform moderation and policies guiding AI regulation are enabling colonial interference, culturally and politically in digital spaces.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: As the Kenyan researcher and political analyst Nanjala Nyabola asks in reference to Cambridge Analytica’s hand in the Kenyan election: “What does accountability for political misinformation look like when a British company uses an American platform to influence political discourse in a Kenyan election?” There are few incentives for platforms to address these problems.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Big tech’s choices are consistently driven by public perception, business risk, the threat of regulation and the spectacle of PR fires.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: That’s why platforms are quick to scrub QAnon content in the US or meet GDPR regulations in the EU, but don’t show the same attention when dealing with health disinformation in Kenya, or adhering to the country’s incitement laws.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: The policies and values of these platforms have normalised a kind of deviance – one that enables a dismissal of regions and populations that fall in its “rest of the world” category.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: As the election draws nearer, many platforms are still unwilling to publicly commit to a roadmap that outlines how they are going to fight misinformation and disinformation in Kenya and Africa more broadly.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: We need platforms to inform Kenyan users about how they will use algorithms to spot hate speech and election-related disinformation; how they will foster relationships with civil society to factcheck content in English, Kiswahili and Sheng; and finally, how they’ll help Kenyans get accurate information about where to vote.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Election disinformation is not a problem that platforms can fix on their own.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: However, they have an outsized responsibility to protect Kenyan civil society and our democratic discourse.

Title: Kenya’s already fragile elections now face a dangerous new enemy: big tech platforms
Line: Odanga Madung is a Mozilla fellow, journalist and data scientist based in Nairobi, Kenya

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Acting is all about immersing yourself in a character, embracing someone else’s reality and leaving yourself behind in the process.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: That is, unless you go for the ultimate role: yourself.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: For those who have been unable to resist the allure of the familiar, appearing as a heightened version of themselves in a film can lead to one of the most intriguing performances of their career.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Nicolas Cage is the latest actor to put his on- and off-screen persona under the white-hot glare of the Hollywood microscope in The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent, a bracingly original meta-comedy.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Not only is he playing himself – albeit a more cash-strapped version facing financial ruin – he also stars as his imaginary alter ego: Nicky (a Wild At Heart-era Cage who has been eerily de-aged with CGI).

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: In recent years, on screen and off, Cage has garnered a reputation for eccentricity, to put it mildly, but he has been at great pains to stress just how far he is from this fictionalised version of himself, even though he also landed himself in serious debt after reportedly spending his $150m fortune.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “I have a lot of quiet moments at home with just my cat, reading,” he told the Hollywood Reporter last month.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “Do we want to show any of that?

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: No, because it’s not fun.” Showing A-list stars on an egotistical rampage – now that’s fun.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Usually, when actors portray themselves in films, it’s played for laughs, although there has been the occasional foray into drama.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “We don’t really know what an actor is like in reality, so what they’re actually performing is a version of themselves that is known and disseminated in culture, in films and by chatshows,” says Dr Andrew Stubbs, senior lecturer in film, media and communication at Staffordshire University.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: The most successful performances within this niche tend to either exaggerate an actor’s public image or play against it completely.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: This is why Bill Murray’s cameo in Zombieland was so effective: he leaned into his off-screen persona as a lovable eccentric, the kind of celebrity who turns up to a stranger’s engagement photoshoot and crashes stag dos.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: In Zombieland, Murray hides out in his huge mansion as the zombie apocalypse rages on around him, pretending to be one of the undead when he ventures out, which just seems like a very Bill Murray thing to do.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Meanwhile, Keanu Reeves’s performance as a smug hipster parody of himself in Always Be My Maybe is a million miles away from his reputation as one of Hollywood’s nicest celebrities, long heralded for being sensitive, humble and unfailingly good natured.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Definitely not the kind of person who would inspire an I Punched Keanu Reeves rap from a love rival, as he does in Nahnatchka Khan’s romcom.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: An actor playing themselves in a film also opens up a chance for reinvention.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Take Neil Patrick Harris, who appears as Cage’s agent in The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Before he starred in Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle, he was primarily known for his role as wholesome medical wunderkind Doogie Howser in the US sitcom.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: His performance as a satirical version of himself in the stoner comedy and the two sequels that followed reinvigorated his career.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Playing an arrogant sleazeball with a predilection for vast amounts of cocaine and strippers allowed him to transition into more adult parts.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: A year later, he joined the cast of How I Met Your Mother as brash womaniser Barney Stinson.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “These films are an opportunity to enhance actors’ brands,” says Stubbs.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “Taking on these roles, they’re often required to be quite self-conscious and self-deprecating.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Those are qualities that are highly valued in our society.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: So in that sense, it helps the actor to shed any ideas about their egotism.” There have been notable performances from female actors playing themselves in films.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Julia Roberts went meta on meta as the wife of a con artist pretending to be Julia Roberts as part of an elaborate heist in Ocean’s Twelve.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Then there is Megan Fox’s cameo in The Dictator, which takes a dig at her overly sexualised image, and Emma Watson shows up wielding an axe in apocalyptic comedy This Is the End.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: But when it comes to celebrities playing themselves, especially in lead roles in films, most of the time, it’s done by a white male actor.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Women and people of colour are sidelined in supporting parts, if they appear at all – just as they are in the wider film industry.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “Actresses’ careers tend to be shorter, they have fewer opportunities to create a successful career and sustain it through the years, so they have to be much more careful,” says Helen O’Hara, author of Women vs Hollywood: The Fall and Rise of Women in Film.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Plus, there’s the ever-persistent misconception that women just aren’t as funny as men.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: They’re not even being given the opportunity to try, she says.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “A lot of these [parts] come along as fun cameos with your friends.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: The comedy groups tend to be quite close-knit groups of men.” Ben Affleck and Matt Damon, for instance, hammed it up hilariously in a guest appearance spoofing their Good Will Hunting success in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, because they’re friends with the director Kevin Smith.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: This Is the End features a host of celebrity cameos but the core clique of the film – its co-director Seth Rogen, James Franco, Jonah Hill, Jay Baruchel and Danny McBride – are close friends who constantly pop up in each other’s films.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “Women have much more to lose than men do, if it goes wrong,” says O’Hara.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “People are much quicker to believe that women are divas.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: So it’s much harder to poke fun at themselves while reinforcing those stereotypes, which could be very damaging to their career.” At the same time, these roles might initially seem lighthearted and playful, but in fact they often cast a satirical eye over the myth of stardom: not just how it’s created by an actor and the Hollywood machine, but also how the public buys into it as well.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: “It can prompt the audience to consider how a star might have been mistreated or misrepresented by paparazzi and the press, and think critically about their star image rather than accepting it at face value,” says Stubbs.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Despite a string of classy dramatic roles on stage and screen, John Malkovich’s most celebrated performance is as himself in Being John Malkovich.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Director Spike Jonze’s audacious comedy revolves around Craig (John Cusack), a puppeteer who discovers a magical portal into the Dangerous Liaisons actor’s mind – and promptly sets up a business selling tickets for $200 a pop so others can be Malkovich for 15 minutes.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Charlie Kaufman’s ingenious script ridicules the emptiness of fame and our worship of celebrities as Malkovich – played with gleeful narcissism as he sends up his dour off-screen persona – starts to unravel spectacularly.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: And that’s what these roles really are – they provide our own portal to glean what we can about celebrity culture, even though we know what we’re really seeing is a reflection from a distorted mirror, a parody of what we think stardom might be rather than the reality.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: Still, we’re being invited to be in on the joke and the actor is being such a good sport, so we’ll probably be laughing along, trying not to cringe too hard if it falls flat.

Title: Going full meta: Nicolas Cage and the actors who love playing themselves
Line: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent is in cinemas from 22 April.

Title: Angus Taylor in pre-election move to make coal plants give five years’ notice before closing
Line: Owners of ageing coal-fired power plants would be required to give at least five years’ notice before shutting under a last-minute rule change proposed by Angus Taylor shortly before the federal election is expected to be called.

Line: Taylor, the energy and emissions reduction minister, said on Thursday he had written to the Australian Electricity Market Commission asking it to extend the notice period for generators to shut from 3.5 to five years to “safeguard the delivery of affordable, reliable power for consumers”.

Title: Angus Taylor in pre-election move to make coal plants give five years’ notice before closing
Line: The proposal was backed by the New South Wales government, but electricity generators and analysts questioned whether it was necessary and suggested it would make little difference if a coal plant was failing or its owner was broke.

Title: Angus Taylor in pre-election move to make coal plants give five years’ notice before closing
Line: The proposal, which will now be subject to a formal commission process including two rounds of public submissions, follows announcements that coal plants would close earlier than scheduled as they increasingly struggle to compete with cheaper renewable energy.

Title: ‘Political’ government ads should be probed by integrity agencies, Victorian opposition says
Line: Victoria’s opposition is urging the state’s integrity agencies to investigate government advertising campaigns found to be in breach of state laws due to their political nature.

Title: ‘Political’ government ads should be probed by integrity agencies, Victorian opposition says

Line: The Vago report said the campaign was political because it could “easily be seen” to promote the Victorian government while attacking the federal government.
